page.title: 12Education and Information
page.content: No school ever in Ridlington.A small school,built by the Countess of Kimberly at Witton in 1834,closed during the 1930's. {Schools}Children between 5 & 8 years go to school at Bacton.Middle school education from children's eighth to twelfth birthdays is at Manor Road School,N.Walsham or at Mundesley's Middle School.Secondary & 6th Form education is based at N.Walsham.All travel by bus.Basic education classes are given to the mentally handicapped at their home,Rookery Farm. {Information}A libary van calls monthly & stops at various points.Inhabitants may choose as many books as they wish. {Media}Newspapers & magazines can be orderded & bought at all 3 local shops.Paperbacks are available at Walcott Post Office.
